basics.name: Benjamin Cifuentes
basics.label: Full Stack Developer | Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a Civil Informatics Engineering student in my fifth year of university, with solid experience in various programming languages. I stand out for my excellent communication skills and my ability to work effectively in teams. My main interest lies in web development and the creation of digital platforms. I am always looking for new opportunities to learn and refine my skills.

work.name: Universidad Austral de Chile
work.summary: Assisted as a teaching assistant in the Software Construction Workshop course, helping students understand fundamental concepts and techniques for software development.
highlights: Facilitated tutorials and activities designed to teach software development principles and practices interactively using NextJs.
Used participatory methods to promote active learning.
Provided support to student groups in the creation and development of their projects, offering technical and methodological guidance.

work.name: Universidad Austral de Chile
work.summary: Assisted as a teaching assistant in the Software Engineering course, helping students understand key elements such as UML diagrams, testing, Git, and refactoring.
highlights: Collaborated with students in solving use cases, helping them create and understand UML diagrams to represent systems and processes.
Delivered sessions on refactoring techniques, explaining how and when to apply them to improve existing code.
Taught the importance of testing in software development, detailing when and how to conduct different types of tests.

work.name: Data Research
work.summary: Contributed to the development of a comprehensive web platform for file and folder management. This solution included advanced functionalities such as authentication, authorization, role and permission management, and a dashboard to analyze user actions, such as account creation and file uploads over time.
highlights: Designed and developed parts of the user interface applying UX/UI design principles.
Implemented interactive and responsive components to ensure accessibility on multiple devices and resolutions.
Developed a robust RESTful API for managing system resources.
Implemented access control and security mechanisms to protect sensitive data.
Created an interactive dashboard to visualize and analyze user action distribution.

work.name: FONDEF IDeA ID22I10072 Project
work.summary: Initial internship for a FONDEF project, consisting of developing a citizen science mobile application focused on community perception of wildfires. The project aimed to engage the community in data collection and analysis regarding forest fires.
highlights: Developed a consistent design system that included reusable components, colors, typography, and other visual elements to maintain application consistency.
Made adjustments to the design to improve the application's usability and aesthetics, ensuring it was user-friendly and visually appealing.
Conducted compatibility tests for the application on different mobile devices to increase reach across as many phones as possible.

projects.name: Thesis - OBSFarma
projects.description: Decision support system and platform for analyzing medical prescriptions using data streaming technologies, pipelines, and cloud storage.

projects.name: FruitSell
projects.description: Mobile application for tracking fruit sales for street vendors, with location tracking and sales summaries.

projects.name: Verifika-Scraping-Bot
projects.description: Scraping bot using web scraping technologies and queued tasks.

projects.name: INBiS
projects.description: Citizen wellbeing analysis platform based on quality-of-life and wellbeing indicators.
